intro: Pavonia subtriloba, commonly known as the three-lobed penta, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Its leaves are palmately lobed, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks.
